Class Board

java.lang.Object
Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
This class manages the change in each cell. It will initialize the game board when the game starts. It also processes the inputs and applies them to the game. It has a 2D array of Cells where the game will actually run.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    Cell[][] gameBoard
    the game board consist of cells that the game actually runs

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Board()
    First constructor which initializes gameBoard to an 8 x 8 size array sets boardsize to 8 Fills the entire array with initialized blank cells
    Board​(int size)
    Second constructor where user can specify the size of the board Sets boardsize to size Fills the entire array with initialized blank cells

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void arrayChange​(int size)
    change the size of the game board to the given size
    void assignMines()
    assigns a certain number of mines to the board randomly until all mines are assigned
    void assignNum()
    Assigns numbers that corresponds to how many mines the 8 cells around that cell has for every cell in the board
    void clearBlanks​(int row, int col)
    recursion algorithm to clear squares
    int countAround​(int row, int col)
    pre-condition: cell is not revealed and is not a mine helper method for assignNum
    boolean inBounds​(int row, int col)
    tells if the coordinate(row, col) is in boundary of the game board
    void printBoard()
    printout the board in terminal
    void refresh()
    set each cell into a new cell object

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • gameBoard

      public Cell[][] gameBoard
      the game board consist of cells that the game actually runs

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      First constructor which initializes gameBoard to an 8 x 8 size array sets boardsize to 8 Fills the entire array with initialized blank cells

    • Board

      public Board​(int size)
      Second constructor where user can specify the size of the board Sets boardsize to size Fills the entire array with initialized blank cells
      Parameters:
      size - row length of a square board

  • Method Details

    • assignMines

      public void assignMines()
      assigns a certain number of mines to the board randomly until all mines are assigned

    • assignNum

      public void assignNum()
      Assigns numbers that corresponds to how many mines the 8 cells around that cell has for every cell in the board

    • clearBlanks

      public void clearBlanks​(int row, int col)
      recursion algorithm to clear squares
      Parameters:
      row - what row on gameBoard
      col - what column on gameBoard

    • countAround

      public int countAround​(int row, int col)
      pre-condition: cell is not revealed and is not a mine helper method for assignNum
      Parameters:
      row - the row coordinate of the cell that will count the number of mines nearby.
      col - the col coordinate of the cell that will count the number of mines nearby.
      Returns:
      number of mines around it

    • inBounds

      public boolean inBounds​(int row, int col)
      tells if the coordinate(row, col) is in boundary of the game board
      Parameters:
      row - row coordinate
      col - col coordinate
      Returns:
      if (row, col) is on the game board

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()
      printout the board in terminal

    • refresh

      public void refresh()
      set each cell into a new cell object

    • arrayChange

      public void arrayChange​(int size)
      change the size of the game board to the given size
      Parameters:
      size - the length of one side of the square shaped game board
